availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Bracken County, Kentucky, farm laborer. Bracken County native. Son of Patterson Monahon and Betsy Cobbler. Farm laborer in Bracken County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken, p. 775.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, Eastern District, p. 10.
Kentucky, County Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Film #000344095, Bracken County, February 16, 1869 (accessed via ancestry.com).
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates Microfilm (1911-1964), KDLA, Roll # 7017504, Bracken County, File No. 25916B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Bracken County, KY, June & July 1863, p. 267, (accessed via ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "Alfred N. Moneyhon (1839-1925)," Memorial #73447666, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/73447666/alfred-nichols-moneyhon (accessed July 3, 2018).
